page.title: 05TRANSPORT & CHILDREN
page.content: PUBLIC TRANSPORT All the children have travelled on a bus, mainly to the nearby towns of Epsom and Kingston. Most have been on a main line train, either to London, a journey of about 15 miles, or on holiday trips or outings to the South Coast, Brighton, Bognor or Littlehampton. Many children have also travelled on the London Transport underground trains. Very few children have travelled on an aeroplane, and the ones who have all went abroad on holiday, mostly to Europe, one or two to North America, Africa and the Far East. The small number of children who have experienced travel by ship went to the Isle of Wight and to France.
